page.title: 15SCHOOL MEALS SERVICE
page.content: The School Meals Service is provided by the County and subsidised by the rate payers. The meal costs 65 pence but a meal is provided free, to children of families of low income. As there are no kitchens at Twineham School the meals are brought by taxis at County expense. 2 Servery Assistants are employed by the School Meals Service, to serve the meals and 1 Midday Supervisor by the County, to watch over pupils remaining on the premises during the lunch hour. Teachers do not perform a supervisory role during this period, unless they wish. They receive a meal in payment, which is eaten with the children. It is understood that Head Teachers and their Deputies remain on duty during this time, but this is not contractual At Twineham there are no Graded Posts and no Deputy Headteacher.
